questions-answers.question: What is the purpose of this repository?
questions-answers.answer: The purpose of this repository is to provide a fix for the original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr extension by hnmr293. It aims to maintain and provide updates for the community as the original maintainer hasn't been accepting pull requests lately.

questions-answers.question: Who created the original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr extension?
questions-answers.answer: The original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr extension was created by hnmr293.

questions-answers.question: What are latent nodes?
questions-answers.answer: Latent nodes in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr are a set of nodes responsible for handling operations on 4-channel latent tensors. These nodes are used for various operations like VAE encoding and decoding, random latent image generation, latent to image conversion, and more.

questions-answers.question: What is the input type and output type of the KSamplerOverrided node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
questions-answers.answer: The KSamplerOverrided node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr accepts various input types and outputs latents.

questions-answers.question: Can I merge two models using ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
questions-answers.answer: Yes, you can merge two models in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr using the StateDictMergerBlockWeightedMulti node, which merges two models with per-block weights.

questions-answers.question: What is the role of the ImageBlend2 node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
questions-answers.answer: The ImageBlend2 node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr is used for blending two images together with additional blend modes.

questions-answers.question: Who contributed to the development of ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
questions-answers.answer: Contributions to ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr were made by hnmr293, spacepxl, and WeeBull.
